net.sf.jclal.util.sort

Class IndexValueContainer

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.jclal.util.sort.IndexValueContainer
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AcumulativeDistanceContainer, DistanceContainer

    public class IndexValueContainer
extends java.lang.Object
    Class to store values in accordance with an index and a value, for the specific case of that the elements change their position and it is necessary to preserve their original position.
    Author:
    Oscar Gabriel Reyes Pupo, Eduardo Perez Perdomo

        The accumulative value for an instance.

      • getIndexesChanges

        public int[] getIndexesChanges()
        It stores a pair of values that represents the new index (key) with the current index of the array, and the old index (value) of an instance with the values stored in the array.
        Returns:
        the indexes changes.

      • setIndexesChanges

        public void setIndexesChanges(int[] indexesChanges)
        It stores a pair of values that represents the new index (key) with the current index of the array, and the old index (value) of an instance with the values stored in the array.
        Parameters:
        indexesChanges - The indexes that were changed.

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        Get the size.
        Returns:
        The current size. The size changes from calling to the method deleteIndex(int index).

      • isUpdateMaxAcumulativeValue

        public boolean isUpdateMaxAcumulativeValue()
        Returns whether it is necessary to determine the maximum accumulative value
        Returns:
        The flag of max acumulative value.
